meanings.definition: A small, hard knot or lump in wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter noticed a knag in the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to get a splinter from the knag in the fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the knag as a tiny seat.
meanings.sent4: The knag in the tree trunk resembled a tiny mountain.
meanings.sent5: The knag stood out like a tiny bump on a smooth surface.

meanings.sent1: She would knag her brother to clean up his room every day.
meanings.sent2: The dripping faucet would knag at his patience all night.
meanings.sent3: The persistent mosquito seemed to knag at his ears all night.
meanings.sent4: The constant beeping of the alarm clock knagged at his sleep.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping tap knagged at his concentration.

meanings.sent1: The knag on the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The knag on the wall caught the hem of her dress.
meanings.sent3: The knag on the tree branch looked like a tiny hook.
meanings.sent4: The knag on the mountain peak was visible from afar.
meanings.sent5: The knag on the cliff edge was a dangerous spot to stand.
